rukus.text: A sending down successively from The Merciful, The Compassionate
a Book in which its signs we37:181re explained distinctly, an Arabic Recitation for a folk who know
a bearer of glad tidings and a warner, but most of them turned aside so they hear not
And they said: Our hearts are sheathed from that to which thou hast called us and in our ears is a heaviness and between us and between thee is a partition. So work. Truly, we, too, are ones who work

Say: I am only a mortal like you. It is revealed to me that your God is God, One; so go straight to Him and ask for forgiveness from Him, and woe to the ones who are polytheistsâ€”those who give not the purifying alms
and who in the world to come are ones who disbelieve
Truly, those who believed and did as the ones in accord with morality, for them will be compensation, that which is unfailing
